title: Does a Single Volcanic Eruption Release as Much CO2 As All of Humanity Has to Date?
subtitle: No matter how you look at it, the amount of carbon dioxide emitted by volcanoes is significantly lower than the amount emitted by anthropogenic sources on human timescales.
author: Alex Kasprak
vclaim: A single eruption from a volcano puts 10,000 times more carbon dioxide into the atmosphere than all of human activity has throughout history.
